We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD3$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD3$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{3}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD5$.  

  So  $\blueD5$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{3}{,}\blueD5$ $\_$ $\_$

The next smallest digit is the $\purpleC7$.  The $\purpleC7$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{3}{,}\blueD5\purpleC7$  $\_$

The greatest digit is the $\greenD7$.  The  $\greenD7$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{3}{,}\blueD5\purpleC7\greenD7$ 

The smallest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{3}{,}\blueD5\purpleC7\greenD7$.
